I was looking though the past debate challenges and found this argument here about the spread of AIDS in the US. It seems as if the poster "ShadowPikachu" has decided to not start a debate on it, and it looks like JP may have some interest but not enough to start a debate here.
 
 
 So, I'd like to start it (I would like to do it here as I have come to dislike the open forums which are filled with personal attacks and ad-homs and I hope this will not be like that), and take up the side of JPSartre12.
 
 Resolved: The AIDS epidemic in the US reached critical mass primarily as a result of homosexual activities.
 
 I contend that HIV/AIDS has spread to the levels that it is seen at today in the US due primarily to homosexuals. Homosexuals were the first in the US to begin contracting AIDS, and their activities (in bath houses, having anal sex, oral sex, etc.) spread the disease like wildfire.
 
 In fact, it is quite telling that the AIDS virus was first called GRID - Gay Related Immunodeficiency Disease before the PC crowd applied pressure to rename it to a more neutral name. Link here to a 1982 paper where GRID is mentioned: http://www.aegis.org/news/nyt/1982/NYT820610.html Once it was permeating the Gay Community blood supply it spread through the bisexuals of the community (very often to their unsuspecting heterosexual partners) and the innumerous Gay intraveous drug users throughout the general populace, and then through the numerous gays that supplied blood to blood banks (many of them even after it was revealed that it could be spread through blood and that gays should be tested first, etc.), shich sent it even further into the general population.
 
 Here is a timeline: http://www.aegis.com/topics/timeline/default.asp
 (emphasis mine)
 
1978 Gay men in the US and Sweden -- and heterosexuals in Tanzania and Haiti -- begin showing signs of what will later be called AIDS. 
 
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 1979 
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 1980 Deaths in US -- 31 (includes all known cases 1981 and before) 
 
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 1981 On June 5th, the CDC reports that in the period October 1980-May 1981, 5 young men, all active homosexuals, were treated for biopsy-confirmed Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia at 3 different hospitals in Los Angeles, California. Two of the patients died. All 5 patients had laboratory-confirmed previous or current cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection and candidal mucosal infection. 
 On July 4th, the CDC reports that during the past 30 months, 26 cases of Kaposi Sarcoma have been reported among Gay males, and that eight have died, all within 24-months of diagnosis. 
 Number of known deaths in US during 1981 -- 234. 
 
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 1982 CDC (USA) links the new disease to blood. 
 The term AIDS ("acquired immune dificiency syndrome") is used for the first time on July 27th. 
 Larry Speakes, President Reagan's press secretary jokes about AIDS during press briefing on October 15th. 
 US President Ronald Reagan has not mentioned the word "AIDS" in public yet. 
 The Gay Mens Health Crisis is founded in New York City. 
 Number of known deaths in US during 1982 -- 853. 
 
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 1983 CDC (USA) warns blood banks of a possible problem with the blood supply. 
 Institut Pasteur (France) finds the virus (HIV). 
 US President Ronald Reagan has not mentioned the word "AIDS" in public yet. 
 Number of known deaths in US during 1983 -- 2304. 
 
 

 
 It is well known that homosexual sex spreads HIV/AIDS more easily than heterosexual sex, mainly due to the parts of the body that are being used in each - the anus is quite open to transmittal of the virus, while the vagina is much less conducive to the transmittal of the virus.
 
 I would go so far as to say that if "Patient Zero" had in fact been a heterosexual, there is a large possibility that there would never have been a "Patient one".
 
 Well, hopefully this will be a good startup for thedebate - I will post more later on.

post_info.post_title: AIDS in the US reached critical mass primarily due to homosexual activities

I was looking though the past debate challenges and found this argument here about the spread of AIDS in the US. It seems as if the poster "ShadowPikachu" has decided to not start a debate on it, and it looks like JP may have some interest but not enough to start a debate here.
 
 
 So, I'd like to start it (I would like to do it here as I have come to dislike the open forums which are filled with personal attacks and ad-homs and I hope this will not be like that), and take up the side of JPSartre12.
 
 Resolved: The AIDS epidemic in the US reached critical mass primarily as a result of homosexual activities.
 
 I contend that HIV/AIDS has spread to the levels that it is seen at today in the US due primarily to homosexuals. Homosexuals were the first in the US to begin contracting AIDS, and their activities (in bath houses, having anal sex, oral sex, etc.) spread the disease like wildfire.

 
 This is really just finger-pointing, though. To say it spread "due" to a certain group is offensive and accomplishes nothing, a point made(in relation to Haitians) in this informative article:
 
 http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/11/04/AR2007110400959_pf.html
 
 Are gay people any less unwitting victims of the initial spread of a sexually(not merely homosexually), transmitted virus? It would make sense that it would stay mostly in the community where members only have sex with one another(rarely with heterosexuals). When it spreads to heterosexuals from their activities, are they less responsible, it is less "due" to them because they identify with the heterosexual label or group? 
 
 
In fact, it is quite telling that the AIDS virus was first called GRID - Gay Related Immunodeficiency Disease before the PC crowd applied pressure to rename it to a more neutral name. Link here to a 1982 paper where GRID is mentioned: http://www.aegis.org/news/nyt/1982/NYT820610.html

 
 It wasn't an accurate name however, as it happens to heterosexuals as well. Keeping the inaccurate name would serve what purpose?
 
 
Once it was permeating the Gay Community blood supply it spread through the bisexuals of the community (very often to their unsuspecting heterosexual partners) and the innumerous Gay intraveous drug users throughout the general populace,

 
 "Innumerous" gay IV drug users, you make it sound like it's especially prevelent amongst gay people, and that isn't so. It also spread through heterosexual IV drug users. Drug use has nothing to do with sexuality. 
 
 
It is well known that homosexual sex spreads HIV/AIDS more easily than heterosexual sex, mainly due to the parts of the body that are being used in each - the anus is quite open to transmittal of the virus, while the vagina is much less conducive to the transmittal of the virus.

 
 Gay people have the same types of sex as heterosexuals. It may be more easily spread through anal sex than vaginal. However there are many other variables to consider for an individual person and risk. Unprotected vaginal sex is considered high risk for transmission of HIV. 
 
 
I would go so far as to say that if "Patient Zero" had in fact been a heterosexual, there is a large possibility that there would never have been a "Patient one".

 
 There's really no such thing as a "patient zero", as my link above shows. It doesn't go from zero to one. That isn't reality.
Heterosexuals have anal sex too. And lesbians are among the least likely to contract HIV.
Anal sex is common in the heterosexual adult business and instances of AIDs transmission there is very, very rare.

Anal sex is common in the heterosexual adult business and instances of AIDs transmission there is very, very rare.
Did you mean to say "in the adult porn business"?

Heterosexuals have anal sex too. And lesbians are among the least likely to contract HIV.
Clean, faithful heterosexual couples will likely find it impossible to transmit aids between themselves.
 
 Lesbians don't normally deposit bodily fluids in each other's colons.

Did you mean to say "in the adult porn business"?

 
 I tried to keep it PG13. 
 
 You just ruined it. Shame on you.

Clean, faithful heterosexual couples will likely find it impossible to transmit aids between themselves.
 

 
 Unless one of them had a bad blood transfusion in the 1980s. In any case, faithful homosexual couples are just as safe.

I'll get to the other posts when I can but this caught my eye the other day.
 
 
 Top "Gay" Organization Comes Clean: "HIV is a gay disease." 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 Washington, D.C. - In a public statement last Friday, Matt Foreman, outgoing Executive Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force, rattled the homosexual activist community by joining the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), pro-family organizations and a growing number of homosexual activists willing to admit that homosexual behavior is both extremely high-risk and primarily responsible for the spread of HIV/AIDS in the U.S. 
 
 
 Addressing the topic of AIDS, Foreman drastically deviated from the "gay" lobby's party line by admitting, "Internally, when these numbers come out, the 'established' gay community seems to have a collective shrug as if this isn't our problem. Folks, with 70 percent of the people in this country living with HIV being gay or bi, we cannot deny that HIV is a gay disease. We have to own that and face up to that." 
 
 A little over a year ago, Lorri Jean, CEO of the Los Angeles-based Gay and Lesbian Center, similarly shocked the "gay" community by stating that, "HIV is a Gay Disease. Own it. End it." 
 
 
 Foreman's admission comes on the heels of a letter from Matt Barber, Concerned Women for America's (CWA) Policy Director for Cultural Issues, inviting Foreman and other homosexual activists to work together in discouraging homosexuals from engaging in the high-risk behaviors researchers recently determined are responsible for the epidemic spread of a potentially deadly strain of staph infection among certain segments of the "gay" community. The CDC has acknowledged that many of those same high-risk behaviors, such as male-male anal sex, are chiefly responsible for spreading HIV/AIDS. 
 
 
 Matt Barber addressed Foreman's admission: "It's extremely encouraging to see Matt Foreman, a homosexual activist who has for so long been in denial about the dangers of the lifestyle he has promoted, publicly coming to terms with the undeniable perils of that lifestyle. 
 
 "I only hope he will now stop promoting homosexual conduct and push for other liberal elites, especially those running our public schools, to do the same. Educators must truthfully address the 'gay' lifestyle's potentially deadly consequences. 
 
 "It's criminally reckless for the National Education Association and liberal educators to put political correctness and a deceptive political agenda above the lives, health and well-being of America's children. The evidence is there for all to see. 'Gayness' is not about 'who you are,' it's about 'what you do.' The National Gay and Lesbian Task Force has now, in effect, acknowledged that reality. Their honesty is refreshing and unexpected," concluded Barber. 
 
 http://www.cwfa.org/articles/14708/MEDIA/nation/index.htm

 Adult and Adolescent Male Adult and Adolescent Female Total

 Heterosexual contact 11,111 ... the difference is not great. The main reason for the larger number of Homosexual cases has been determined to be a result of homosexual promiscuity. The answer to the AIDS epidemic is relatively simple. So simple in fact it defies logic that nobody has thought of it before.
 
 Stop having sex! It's that simple. If you don't sleep around with people you don't know, you have little risk of getting infected.
 
 And if that's too hard for you, then stop having unprotected sex, no excuses. Get yourself tested, get your partners tested. And if that's too much work, then see the first solution: stop having sex!

Protected sex is safer, but not totally safe. You also better not have sex with a drug user, or indeed allow a doctor or dentist to inject you with anything, in case the needle is not clean. Blood transfusions can carry the virus, so they're out, unless you set up a personal blood bank, which only you donate to or withdraw from. Sharing a toothbrush could get you killed too...... In other words, the vectors of transmission of the virus are many and varied, and not limited to the sexual act, as ignorant prudes and homophobes would have you believe..

Really it's all up to us as individuals to take responsibility for our actions. I don't hope that anyone should have to suffer with aids. Gays are banned from donating blood so it shouldn't be an issue at all. I do support stricter penalties for anyone spreading it.

 Mandela and Mbeki are gone .South Africa has a Zulu rapist as head of state now...
 
 
 Mbeki's more inclusive stance led some to connect him to AIDS denialism. While serving as deputy President, AIDS was in his portfolio, and he customarily wore a red ribbon while specifically promoting AIDS prevention measures. He did preside over a controversial and brief embrace of a South African experimental drug called Virodene which later proved to be ineffective; the episode appeared to have increased his skepticism about the scientific consensus that quickly condemned the drug.
 
 After he assumed the Presidency, he appears to have articulated more clearly his understanding that poverty is a significant co-factor in the prevalence of AIDS and other health problems. He urged political attention be directed to addressing poverty generally rather than only against AIDS specifically. Some speculate that the suspicion engendered by a life in exile and by the colonial domination and control of Africa led Mbeki to react against a portrayal of AIDS as another Western characterisation of Africans as promiscuous and Africa as a continent of disease and hopelessness.[57] For example, speaking to a group of university students in 2001, he struck out against what he viewed as the racism underlying how many in the West characterised AIDS in Africa:
 Convinced that we are but natural-born, promiscuous carriers of germs, unique in the world, they proclaim that our continent is doomed to an inevitable mortal end because of our unconquerable devotion to the sin of lust.[58] 
 Additionally, his views dovetailed with some broader themes in African politics. Many Africans find it suspicious that black Africans bear the largest share of the AIDS burden, and that the drugs to treat it are expensive and sold mainly by Western pharmaceutical companies. The history of malicious and manipulative health policies of the colonial and apartheid governments in Africa, including biological warfare programs set up by the apartheid state, also help to fuel views that the scientific discourse of AIDS might be a tool for European and American political, cultural or economic agendas.
 
 ANC rules and Mbeki's commitment to the idea of party discipline mean that he may not publicly criticise the current government policy that HIV causes AIDS and that antiretrovirals should be provided. Some critics of Mbeki continued to assert that notwithstanding he continued to influence AIDS policy through his personal views behind the scenes, a charge which his office regularly denies.[59] However, in a 2007 published biography "Thabo Mbeki: The Dream Deferred", author Mark Gevisser describes how the president, knowing that he was writing the biography, contacted him earlier in 2007. This was to ask whether the author had seen a 100-page paper secretly authored by Mr. Mbeki and distributed anonymously among the ANC leadership six years ago. This paper compared orthodox AIDS scientists to latter-day Nazi concentration camp doctors and portrayed black people who accepted orthodox AIDS science as "self-repressed" victims of a slave mentality. It described the "HIV/AIDS thesis" as entrenched in "centuries-old white racist beliefs and concepts about Africans". In the published biography Mr Gevisser describes the president's view of the disease as apparently shaped by an obsession with race, the legacy of colonialism and "sexual shame".[60]

 Mbeki's more inclusive stance led some to connect him to AIDS denialism. While serving as deputy President, AIDS was in his portfolio, and he customarily wore a red ribbon while specifically promoting AIDS prevention measures. He did preside over a controversial and brief embrace of a South African experimental drug called Virodene which later proved to be ineffective; the episode appeared to have increased his skepticism about the scientific consensus that quickly condemned the drug.
 
 After he assumed the Presidency, he appears to have articulated more clearly his understanding that poverty is a significant co-factor in the prevalence of AIDS and other health problems. He urged political attention be directed to addressing poverty generally rather than only against AIDS specifically. Some speculate that the suspicion engendered by a life in exile and by the colonial domination and control of Africa led Mbeki to react against a portrayal of AIDS as another Western characterisation of Africans as promiscuous and Africa as a continent of disease and hopelessness.[57] For example, speaking to a group of university students in 2001, he struck out against what he viewed as the racism underlying how many in the West characterised AIDS in Africa:
 Convinced that we are but natural-born, promiscuous carriers of germs, unique in the world, they proclaim that our continent is doomed to an inevitable mortal end because of our unconquerable devotion to the sin of lust.[58] 
 Additionally, his views dovetailed with some broader themes in African politics. Many Africans find it suspicious that black Africans bear the largest share of the AIDS burden, and that the drugs to treat it are expensive and sold mainly by Western pharmaceutical companies. The history of malicious and manipulative health policies of the colonial and apartheid governments in Africa, including biological warfare programs set up by the apartheid state, also help to fuel views that the scientific discourse of AIDS might be a tool for European and American political, cultural or economic agendas.
 
 ANC rules and Mbeki's commitment to the idea of party discipline mean that he may not publicly criticise the current government policy that HIV causes AIDS and that antiretrovirals should be provided. Some critics of Mbeki continued to assert that notwithstanding he continued to influence AIDS policy through his personal views behind the scenes, a charge which his office regularly denies.[59] However, in a 2007 published biography "Thabo Mbeki: The Dream Deferred", author Mark Gevisser describes how the president, knowing that he was writing the biography, contacted him earlier in 2007. This was to ask whether the author had seen a 100-page paper secretly authored by Mr. Mbeki and distributed anonymously among the ANC leadership six years ago. This paper compared orthodox AIDS scientists to latter-day Nazi concentration camp doctors and portrayed black people who accepted orthodox AIDS science as "self-repressed" victims of a slave mentality. It described the "HIV/AIDS thesis" as entrenched in "centuries-old white racist beliefs and concepts about Africans". In the published biography Mr Gevisser describes the president's view of the disease as apparently shaped by an obsession with race, the legacy of colonialism and "sexual shame".[60]
